main event: A bright, glowing object was spotted in the sky above St. Louis, Missouri on April 7, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as being as large or larger than a large plane, about four times as long as it was wide, and throwing off fluorescent light.
The object had a trail behind it, shaped like a rectangle.
The object was moving at an unspecified speed.
No radio or telephone communication was reported about the object.
The case was downgraded to an 'insufficient data for evaluation' classification on appeal by the order of the Commander of Air Division Five years later.
sighted object: a bright, glowing object shaped like a rectangular object with a trail
photographs: no photographs included in the report
